thread.title: Eden Hazard left 'seeing double' by Chelsea team-mate N'Golo Kante in West Ham victory
thread.title_full: Eden Hazard left 'seeing double' by Chelsea team-mate N'Golo Kante in West Ham victory

author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Eden Hazard left 'seeing double' by Chelsea team-mate N'Golo Kante in West Ham victory
text:
Kante has impressed Hazard with his recent performances (Photo: Rex) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
N'Golo Kante has got Eden Hazard seeing double â€“ as the incredible Frenchman closes in on one of his own. 
Hazard said the tireless midfielder was "everywhere" against West Ham to the point where it felt like he was playing alongside Kante twins. 
Kante produced yet another lung-bursting, tigerish tackling-filled display in Chelsea's 2-1 win at West Ham. 
Hazard and Diego Costa got the goals that fired Chelsea to a victory at the London Stadium that restored their 10-point lead. 
But it was Kante, with his uncanny ability to read opponents' minds, who played a just as crucial role again and started the move that led to Hazard's vital opener with a trademark interception. Read More Hazard hit home the opening goal against West Ham (Photo: REUTERS) Kante's performance was one of the highlights of the game (Photo: Darren Walsh) 
Blues star Hazard said: "I don't need to say something about him that everyone knows. He is everywhere. I think sometimes when I am on the pitch I see him twice. 
"One on the left and one on the right. I think I'm playing with twins. 
"He is a fantastic player, he helps the team a lot and we are happy to have him on the team." 
Barring a spectacular Chelsea collapse, Kante will be seeing double at the end of the season too when he looks at his medal collection. View gallery 
He is heading for another title after his shock success with Leicester last season. 
That would make him the first outfield player to win back-to-back Premier League titles with two different teams. 
Goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer is the only other player to do it - with the same two clubs as Kante - though he didn't play a single minute in the league for either side. 
By contrast Kante has been integral to both Leicester last season and Chelsea this. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
